page.title: 06The Hat Factory
page.content: The Hat Factory is over 200 years old. It used to make hats for the Quakers of the villages. It had a water wheel which provided power for machines. It was then taken over by a Company (The Clay Cross Company) quarrying at the back of the factory, and the Hat Factory was turned into worker's cottages. The railroad ran from the quarry by the Hat Factory into the village and went under the road at the post office and then dropped down to the lime kilns at Ambergate. The trucks carrying the lime stone were first pulled by horses and later engines were used.The White House called Thorndale Cottage was the overseer's house and opposite the Hat Factory was another 3 storey building which has now been taken down where the workers on the railroad lived.
